title: English Open Snooker draw, schedule, TV channel, live stream, odds and prize money
text:
Ronnie O’Sullivan is heading to Crawley again (Picture: VCG via Getty Images)

The English Open begins on Monday in Crawley and it has attracted almost all the big names in snooker as the Home Nations Series begins.

A £70,000 top prize is on the line, but there is the added carrot of £1m on offer for any player who manages to win all four of the Home Nations tournaments this season.

It is extremely unlikely (no one has won more than one of the four events in a season before) but it is certainly a tempting bonus to aim for.

As such, Ronnie O’Sullivan is in town, as are the likes of Judd Trump, Mark Selby, Neil Robertson among a host of big names heading to the K2 Leisure Centre.

Stuart Bingham won the English Open last year (Picture: Visual China Group via Getty Images)

English Open prize money

Winner: £70,000

Runner-up: £30,000

Semi-final: £20,000

Quarter-final: £10,000

Last 16: £7,500

Last 32: £4,000

Last 64: £3,000

Highest break: £5,000
